Toronto's Uniun Nightclub Has Announced Its Official Closure

Posted by Brittany Prevost on December 20, 2018

Electronic dance music enthusiasts that have visited the Toronto area know that one of the hottest warehouse spaces to satisfy their musical desires is Uniun Nightclub.

Brace yourselves, we're about to tear at your heartstrings -  Bechara "Charles" Khabouth, the hardworking owner and the team behind the beloved venue have recently announced its closure.


The formerly occupied space by Devil's Martini isn't "going quietly". They have revealed that an impressive four-part closing party series will be ending 2018 with a bang, not to mention will allow partygoers to say their final goodbyes.

That's right, ravers, attendees will have the opportunity to experience everything that the club has to offer, one last time, including the undeniably killer sound system and stunning decor. Seriously, those rows of LED vines carefully placed on the ceiling are simply breathtaking!

Special performances by the very talented Borgore, Getter, Manzone + Strong, Joee Cons, DeeCee, Kevin Faria, and Chris La Roque are guaranteed to keep you dancing all night long!

Grab your tickets here, before it's too late!

Although no official statements have been made regarding why the EDM cathedral in King West is closing its doors, one thing is for certain, the parties that were thrown there will forever be known as legendary.

We absolutely can't wait to see how they will transform the space in the future. Until then, we'll be sure to live it up one last time! Will you be attending?

 

Written By Brittany Prevost
